revised_title: Future Developments in Non-Ferrous Metallurgy: Exploiting Metallurgical Phenomena
tldr: This article discusses the future developments in non-ferrous metallurgy, focusing on the exploitation of metallurgical phenomena such as superelasticity, shape memory alloys, and ferro-elasticity. The author highlights the potential for new materials and improved properties in age-hardenable alloys like aluminum-lithium and copper, as well as the importance of understanding grain boundary properties and trace elements in the development of new non-ferrous materials.
